hellen-keller-1.text: 1 - Oh, what a glory doth the world put on

hellen-keller-3.text: 3 - There is a beautiful spirit of gladness everywhere,

hellen-keller-4.text: 4 - The wooded waysides are luminous with brightly painted leaves;

hellen-keller-5.text: 5 - The forest-trees with royal grace have donned

hellen-keller-7.text: 7 - And even the rocks and fences are broidered

hellen-keller-8.text: 8 - With ferns, sumachs and brilliantly tinted ivies.

hellen-keller-9.text: 9 - But so exquisitely blended are the lights and shades,

hellen-keller-10.text: 10 - The golds, scarlets and purples, that no sense is wearied;

hellen-keller-11.text: 11 - For God himself hath painted the landscape.

hellen-keller-12.text: 12 - The hillsides gleam with golden corn;

hellen-keller-13.text: 13 - Apple and peach-trees bend beneath their burdens of golden fruit.

hellen-keller-14.text: 14 - The golden-rods, too, are here, whole armies of them,

hellen-keller-15.text: 15 - With waving plumes, resplendent with gold;

hellen-keller-16.text: 16 - And about the wild grapes, purple and fair and full of sunshine,

hellen-keller-18.text: 18 - Linger, like travelers at an Inn,

hellen-keller-20.text: 20 - And far away the mountains against the blue sky stand

hellen-keller-21.text: 21 - Calm and mysterious, like prophets of God,
